runs.comm: avast, tis down the leg-side
that's more like it. Outside off and swinging away
ahoy, that's the length. Leaping off the deck like a galleon on the high seas
pushed back onto the stumps, and tucked to square leg for the first runs off the bat
short, but too short. Sails way over Sehwag's head
another one, way outside off stump. Anderson usually likes the lights, but he's not controlling it yet, so he's not
strays onto the pads, and there's no chance for Solanki to cut that off
tighter to off stump, and Sehwag swished like a cutlass-wielder as the ball jagged back into him
on the spot to finish. Only one run off the bat in that over. The eight extras rather ruined the effect though
good length to start off, and a hint of nibble off the pitch
fizzing movement off the pitch, Sehwag can't help but chase it. Lovely bowling
short, and Sehwag hops back as if on a peg-leg, and tucks that one off the hip to backward square
avast! That leapt past the left-hander's outside edge. Spirited stuff from the young pup
wafted down to third man
straying off his line this time, Sehwag swishes but no contact
darts onto the back foot to defend into the off side. Sharp sprinting brings a single as Broad swoops to field. Sehwag and sharp sprinting ... that doesn't happen often
nudged away fine as Flintoff gives a touch of width, well fielded by Mascarenhas on the boundary's edge
left alone outside off, but a lovely length
fast and straight, and deflected for a single
full-hearted effort, but Flintoff grimaces in his followthrough once more
short of a length but tight to off stump. Gambhir cuts but is cramped for room, a single nonetheless
Gambhir nurdles down to fine leg. Sehwag has free rein for five balls
pushed firmly into the covers, but can't beat the field. A scampered single all the same
climbs into that one, outside off and on a good length. Not timed but effective enough
short and smeared with intent - hits high on the bat though and Gambhir is lucky to clear the man at wide mid-on
shorter and flailed into the off side again, like a grog-addled mutineer
short again, and misses out again. This time the pull shot is timed better, but straight to midwicket
Sehwag gives himself room, but Broad sees him go and follows him. Well done that lad
avast, the first six of the innings. Short and clobbered over midwicket
tucked away to rotate the strike
into position for an elegant drive, but no timing in the shot
sneaky manoeuvre from Sehwag, backing away and he earns the wide as Broad pushes it a touch outside off. Probably a fair call
back on a good length, and dabbed down the track
fuller and straighter, and whipped off the pads with a flick of the wrists. Hauled in from the boundary's edge at midwicket. Effective over for India
outside off stump and climbing through to the keeper
fuller and straighter, Sehwag hustles his shot into the leg side and finds the gap
strange shot that time, Sehwag hops across to whip into the leg side, but is beaten by the bounce. Nipped off the seam and through to the keeper
too much room that time
cracking effort from Broad at third man, hauled in a certain four after a bit of width from Flintoff
raps the pads and runs away to gully
oops, that's too short and smeared over the leg side for a one-bounce boundary
fuller length and nurdled away down to third man
x marks the spot for Dimitri. Gambhir can only nudge that away for another single
up up and away, opened the blade to a bit of width, and that's hit a spectator at deep point like a cannonball
good cricket, pushed into the covers and back for a second with some excellent running between the wickets
wide of off stump and dabbed down to third man
short and Sehwag uses the extra bounce to lift that clean over the head of third man. That's always the danger for Tremlett in one-day cricket
lovely work between the wickets. Dab and run
too wide and Gambhir slashes that with immense power past Collingwood at backward point
oh dear, we've got a free hit coming up ... not clever with Sehwag back on strike
wonderful response. Yorker length, and just misses off stump. It would have been a waste if it had hit
good batting once again from Sehwag, not getting greedy in this over. Rotates the strike well
outside off stump and swinging away to the keeper. A good recovery from Tremlett. It would have been out with the cat o' nine tails if he'd overstepped again
the shot was on, but Sehwag missed with a slashing cut. A bit fortunate for Anderson there ...
full, on leg stump. Gambhir needed to play that finer to beat the field, but it's a good diving stop nonetheless at short backward square
whipped wristily into the leg-side, fuller length again
premeditated, and carved off middle stump out to deep point where Flintoff stoops and fields
lovely shot, outside off, full length, angled through the cordon and away to the third man boundary. Great skill and improvisation
dropped. That's a howler! Massive swing from Sehwag, it went spiralling up and over the non-existent slip cordon, and Mascarenhas let it through his fingers
outside off and well taken by Solanki
a big wind-up and bludgeoned through midwicket
wonderful timing - not a lot wrong with the ball, but just too much width. Sehwag slapped it brutally up and over the point boundary. It's already an expensive miss
that's a fine double-whammy. Fuller and straighter, and thumped along the ground through the covers
that's a vile long-hop but Collingwood gets away with it. Midwicket fields on the boundary
a shimmy to leg and on driven, well run as well, converting a tight two into an easy couple
full outside off stump, he has to stoop to reach it with extended arms and all he can do is squeeze it into the covers
cuttable length, and that's what Gambhir tries to do, but he misses ... slightly slower delivery and that did for him
fuller, again Gambhir steps back and cuts into the ground, the ball scoots into the covers and they have to be happy with a strolled single
Sehwag steps to the leg side, it's short and he tries to help it on its way but misses
a great yorker, Sehwag jabs down on it just in time, gets an inside edge and the ball flies past his leg stump and races to the boundary
a slog, no other word, but highly effective, he steps back and absolutely leathers that past Tremlett who would have been wise to have ducked had it been a foot lower
cuts but the ball is way too wide, a fumble allows the batsmen to scurry a single
gives himself room and larrups that through the off side
swished off his hips behind square on the leg side
another ugly heave from Gambhir, he misses but the ball hits him high on the leg and into the off side, Anderson fields
Sehwag steps to leg and ducks, it wasn't that short and he seemed to lose it
no wide but Tremlett a bit lucky ... Sehwag stepped to leg, Tremlett fired it down the off but it was still fairly wide even if the batsman had still been where he should have been
banged in, hooked but not middled, the ball dribbles to Flintoff behind square on the leg side
more crease skipping, Sehwag steps to the leg and hammers the ball over the covers ... there's a man out there for just that shot
firm drive to Mascarenhas at long-on
worked from outside off stump to short fine leg
much too short, way over Gambhir's head
full toss, launched towards deep midwicket, it lands two yards inside the boundary and plugs
cut to third man
straight, patted back to Maddy
a swing, a thick inside edge beats short fine leg. "Son of a Biscuit Eater," yells Maddy. Well, almost ...
much better, much crisper, two steps and hammered over extra cover
one step this time and flicked to deep midwicket
slog-driven to long-on
squeezed off his toes to short fine leg
full toss that got exactly what is deserved, four runs smashed through midwicket
Gambhir back and content to pat the ball to point and stroll the single.  Tremlett looks rather unhappy with life
driven to deep extra cover, the man had some way to move and Sehwag sprinted back for the second
the breakthrough but methinks too late to be of consequence ... Sehwag steps to the off and is clean bowled ... Tremlett punches the air
stands tall, drops the ball at his feet and runs
slashed in the air to third man, the ball falls five or so yards short of Shah
deftness in a sea of hoicks ... run off the face of the bat ever so fine on the leg side, using the pace of the ball to do all the work
driven high and straight, Shah round from long-off and he makes a neat sliding stop
Gambhir tries to flick to leg but only succeeds in paddling to short fine leg and the ball loops invitingly to Flintoff
Dhoni tries to hit into the off with no footwork and misses
clipped off his toes to Flintoff at deep square leg ... quick running out pressure on and it worked
backfoot shot through the covers, well placed again
launched over wide midwicket for a one-bounce four, beautifully picked up and timed
flowing square drive, all along the ground to the man on the boundary edge
driven with bottom hand aplenty to long-on
down the leg side, no sniff of swing, right where it was aimed, a heave and a miss from Dhoni
Uthappa steps two or three paces to the off and is bowled by a full delivery ... a gamble, but aren't most shots at this stage of Twenty20?
short and lively welcome from Tremlett
driven uppishly over the covers, he gave himself room and timed that sweetly
firm cover drive but not into a gap in the deep
swung into the leg side, well picked up
full toss, driven on the bounce to Collingwood at long-off
half-volley which he squeezes with an open face over point for a one bounce four ... a high-risk shot but his connection was sweet
short, hooked into the heavens where it hangs for several seconds before plopping two yards in from the boundary and perfectly between two approaching fielders
chipped to long-on
that's out the ground, super shot over cow corner and it just kept going up
now that really is sweet, no more than a dismissive flick off his legs, swatting a fly, and the ball arcs deep into the crowd beyond backward square leg

he's hitting them everywhere, he steps to leg and smashes the ball over extra cover and it keeps on travelling ... the fireworks start on top of the scoreboard ... they've been going off in the middle for some time
Shiver me timbers!:  Broad goes round the wicket, bowls a filthy wide full toss and Yuvraj steers it over backward point and it clears the rope again
down on one knee and larruped over midwicket, that one was more nine iron, it went into the night sky and dropped with a thud in the jubilant crowd ...
and he has, Yuvraj leans back and smacks that over wide mid-on ... it was the maximum from the moment it left that bat and the crowd were roaring as it  flew
after the Lord Mayor's Show ... reverse sweep for a single
full toss and a wide one -  it pitched nearer the keeper than the stumps - Yuvraj leaves and then he and Flintoff chat
improvised chip into the leg side, he stepped to the off and eased it one bounce to deep midwicket
Flintoff's turn to suffer, a full swing and launched over long-off
finally he doesn't quite get hold of one and thwacks a full toss to long-on. It matters not one jot, he's done his job and the crowd stand in appreciation
a low-key finish as Dhoni works it to leg, but even a six out of the ground would have been low-key after Yuvraj's fireworks
